contentrichtext.text: The '''Limehouse Declaration''' was a statement issued on 25 January 1981 by four senior [[United Kingdom|British]] [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] politicians, all [[Member of Parliament|MP]]s or former MPs and [[Cabinet (government)|Cabinet Ministers]]: [[Roy Jenkins]], [[David Owen]], [[Bill Rodgers (politician)|Bill Rodgers]] and [[Shirley Williams]].<ref name="bbc 2011">{{cite news|newspaper=BBC News | title= The legacy of the SDP's Gang of Four | url= http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-12170121 | date= {{start date|2011|1|12}} | last=Ley | first= Shaun }}</ref> It became known as the Limehouse Declaration as it was made from David Owen's [[London]] home in [[Limehouse]].<ref name="bbc 2011"/> In this document the so-called 'Gang of Four' signalled their intent to leave the [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour Party]] and form a Council for [[Social Democracy]], as they felt the party had been taken over by the left-wing members.<ref name="guardian">{{cite news|newspaper=The Guardian|title=Looking back on Limehouse| date={{start date|2006|1|21}} | url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/politics/2006/jan/21/labour.liberaldemocrats}}</ref> This Council became the basis for the British [[Social Democratic Party (UK)|Social Democratic Party]] (SDP). == The Gang of Four == The Gang of Four was made up of: *[[Roy Jenkins]] - Former [[Home Secretary]], [[Deputy Leader of the Labour Party (UK)|Deputy Leader of the Labour Party]], [[Chancellor of the Exchequer]] and [[Member of Parliament|MP]] for [[Birmingham Stechford (UK Parliament constituency)|Birmingham Stechford]]. He became the first leader of the SDP and was elected MP for [[Glasgow Hillhead (UK Parliament constituency)|Glasgow Hillhead]] *[[David Owen]] - MP for [[Plymouth Devonport (UK Parliament constituency)|Plymouth Devonport]], former [[Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs]]. He became leader of the SDP in 1983 after Jenkins's resignation *[[Bill Rodgers, Baron Rodgers of Quarry Bank|Bill Rodgers]] - MP for [[Stockton-on-Tees (UK Parliament constituency)|Stockton-on-Tees]], former [[Secretary of State for Transport]] *[[Shirley Williams]] - Former [[Secretary of State for Education|Secretary of State for Education and Science]], [[Paymaster General]], [[Department of Prices and Consumer Protection|Secretary of State for Prices and Consumer Protection]], [[Shadow Home Secretary]] and MP for [[Hertford and Stevenage (UK Parliament constituency)|Hertford and Stevenage]].
